forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy, with a low around 56. South southeast wind 20 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 14 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the night drapes its damp veil over Downtown San Francisco, the city finds itself enshrouded in rain and cloud. With a brisk breeze whispering through the streets, temperatures linger around a mild 56 degrees, a reminder of the time-honored dance between the city and nature's elements. The forecast heralds a continued symphony of rain, punctuated by gusts that swirl at speeds up to 38 mph. A shimmering promise of half an inch of new rainfall shapes the atmosphere, saturating the earth even as the city slumbers.

Come morning, the rain will not relent; it will persist, casting a gloomy, yet familiar pall over the landscape, with high temperatures peaking near 62 before succumbing to the cool air in the afternoon. Fog clings to the hills and the Golden Gate, a soft embrace that blurs the edges of the iconic structures. For those venturing out, layering becomes imperative—embracing the comfort of a waterproof jacket alongside a warm sweater will provide solace against the wind's bite. This day could beckon quiet indoor pursuits: perhaps a leisurely visit to a local café, indulging in a cup of rich brew while the world outside offers its steady percussion of raindrops—a perfect day to curl up with a good book or explore the hidden corners of a gallery, allowing the rhythm of the rain to wash over you, harmonizing with the heartbeat of a vibrant city.
